Package org.eclipse.cdt.core.parser.util

Class CollectionUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.cdt.core.parser.util.CollectionUtils
  • public final class CollectionUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Useful utility methods for dealing with Collections.
    Restriction:
    This class is not intended to be instantiated by clients.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static <T> java.util.Collection<T> filter​(java.util.Collection<T> collection, IUnaryPredicate<T> predicate)
      Filter the elements of a collection down to just the ones that match the given predicate.
      static <T> T findFirstAndRemove​(java.util.List<?> list, java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
      Finds the first object in the heterogeneous list that is an instance of the given class, removes it from the list, and returns it.
      static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable​(java.util.Iterator<T> iter)
      Creates an Iterable instance that just returns the given Iterator from its iterator() method.

      Returns a List corresponding to a T in a Map>.

      U      		 merge​(U c1, U c2)
      Combines two collections into one.
      static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> reverseIterable​(java.util.List<T> list)
      Allows a foreach loop to iterate backwards over a list from the end to the start.
      static <T> java.util.Iterator<T> reverseIterator​(java.util.List<T> list)
      Returns an iterator that iterates backwards over the given list.

    • Method Detail

      • reverseIterator

        public static <T> java.util.Iterator<T> reverseIterator​(java.util.List<T> list)
        Returns an iterator that iterates backwards over the given list. The remove() method is not implemented and will throw UnsupportedOperationException. The returned iterator does not support the remove() method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if list is null

      • reverseIterable

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> reverseIterable​(java.util.List<T> list)
        Allows a foreach loop to iterate backwards over a list from the end to the start.

        Example use: 

             for (Object o : reverseIterable(list)) { ... }
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if list is null

      • iterable

        public static <T> java.lang.Iterable<T> iterable​(java.util.Iterator<T> iter)
        Creates an Iterable instance that just returns the given Iterator from its iterator() method. This is useful for using an iterator in a foreach loop directly.

        Example use: 

             for (Object o : iterable(iterator)) { ... }
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if list is null

      • findFirstAndRemove

        public static <T> T findFirstAndRemove​(java.util.List<?> list,
                                       java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Finds the first object in the heterogeneous list that is an instance of the given class, removes it from the list, and returns it. If there is not object in the list of the given type the list is left unmodified and null is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if list or clazz is null
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if the list's Iterator does not support the remove() method

      • merge

        public static <T,​U extends java.util.Collection<T>> U merge​(U c1,
                                                                  U c2)
        Combines two collections into one.
        Parameters:
        c1 - The first collection. May be modified as a result of the call. May be null.
        c2 - The second collection. May be null.
        Returns:
        A collection containing elements from both input collections, or null if both, c1 and c2 are null.
        Since:
        5.4

      • listMapGet

        public static <T,​U> java.util.List<U> listMapGet​(java.util.Map<T,​java.util.List<U>> m,
                                                       T t)
        Returns a List corresponding to a T in a Map>. If the mapping doesn't exist, creates it with an empty list as the initial value.
        Since:
        5.6

      • filter

        public static <T> java.util.Collection<T> filter​(java.util.Collection<T> collection,
                                                 IUnaryPredicate<T> predicate)
        Filter the elements of a collection down to just the ones that match the given predicate.
        Since:
        5.6
